Literature Review: Text algorithms in economics have become increasingly important in recent years, enabling researchers to analyze and model complex economic data using natural language processing (NLP) techniques. This literature review provides an overview of the methods used for algorithmic text analysis in economics, with a focus on three key contributions: document representation, word representation, and word sequence representation. We also discuss four core empirical tasks that encompass most text-as-data research in economics and highlight the limitations of the current literature, particularly the challenge of validating algorithmic output.
